page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY OF BRIDGEND
page.content: Bridgend is no longer a{market {town}as it is not in the centre of any farm land.The{cattle market}was knocked down in 1976.{Transport}has changed, with people using cars,lorries and buses instead of trains.Many{buildings}have been knocked down to make way for new roads and car parks.When{shopping}fifty years ago a lady would be offered a chair while the shopkeeper took her order.These friendly{family shops}have now been replaced by large self-service{supermarkets.}At eleven, all children go to a{comprehensive school.Fifteen years ago,some went to a{grammar school}and others to a {secondary modern school.}The old {buildings}in Bridgend were mostly made of stone, but the new modern buildings don't fit in that well and the town has lost its character.
